AS3911 Interrupt Handling
AS3911

This part of the AS3911 module abstracts AS3911 interrupt handling. More...

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_WCAP   U32_C(0x010000)

Detailed Description

The AS3911 interrupt logic consists of three byte registers to mask or unmask interupt sources and three additional registers to indicate which interrupts are pending. The content of this pending interrupt registers is automatically cleared on a register read. Additionally a single interrupt line is used to signal any interrupt pending interrupt condition to the microcontroller.

This module abstracts this so the user no longer needs to know to which interrupt register an interrupt source belongs to. To achive this a flat hirarchy of interrupt masks is provided. This module also serves any interrupt requests from the AS3911 and accumulates the pending interrupt requests until the user reads out the interrupt status (as3911GetInterrupts(), as3911WaitForInterruptTimed()).

Enabling and disabling processing of interrupt request from the AS3911

The macros AS3911_IRQ_ON() and AS3911_IRQ_OFF() enable or disable processing of AS3911 interrupt requests by the PIC controller (and thus by this module). If interrupt processing is disabled via AS3911_IRQ_OFF, then no interrupt request will reach the software even if the interrupt source is enabled via as3911EnableInterrupts().

Add startup processing of interrupts by the microcontroller is enabled and therefore AS3911_IRQ_ON() needs to called at least once to enable AS3911 interrupt processing.

Enabling and disabling interrupts.

The functions as3911EnableInterrupts() and as3911DisableInterrupts() can be used to enable or disable specific AS3911 interrupt sources.

Retreiving and reseting the interrupt status.

The function as3911GetInterrupts() can be used to retreive the interrupt status of any combination of AS3911 interrupt source(s). If an interrupt from a source is pending and this interrupt is read out via as3911GetInterrupts() then the penging interrupt is automatically cleared. So a subsequent call to as3911GetInterrupt() will mark that source as not pending (if no additional interrupt happened in between).

The function as3911ClearInterrupts() can be used to clear the interrupt status of an interrupt source.

The function as3911WaitForInterruptTimed can be used to wait for any interrupt out of a set of interrupts to occure. Additionally a timeout can be specified. This function blocks until at least one of the selected interrupts occure or the timeout expires. This function does not enable or disable interrupts. So any interrupt source to wait for needs to be enabled prior to the call via as3911EnableInterrupts.

Define Documentation

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_ALL   U32_C(0xFFFFFF)

All AS3911 interrupt sources.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_CAC   U32_C(0x0400)

AS3911 collision during RF collision avoidance interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_CAT   U32_C(0x0200)

AS3911 minimum guard time expired interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_COL   U32_C(0x04)

AS3911 bit collision interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_CRC   U32_C(0x800000)

AS3911 CRC error interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_DCT   U32_C(0x8000)

AS3911 termination of direct command interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_EOF   U32_C(0x0800)

AS3911 external field off interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_EON   U32_C(0x1000)

AS3911 external field on interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_ERR1   U32_C(0x100000)

AS3911 hard framing error interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_ERR2   U32_C(0x200000)

AS3911 soft framing error interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_GPE   U32_C(0x2000)

AS3911 general purpose timer expired interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_NFCT   U32_C(0x0100)

AS3911 initiator bit rate recognized interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_NONE   U32_C(0)

No AS3911 interrupt source.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_NRE   U32_C(0x4000)

AS3911 no-response timer expired interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_OSC   U32_C(0x80)

AS3911 oscillator stable interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_PAR   U32_C(0x400000)

AS3911 parity error interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_RXE   U32_C(0x10)

AS3911 end of receive interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_RXS   U32_C(0x20)

AS3911 start of receive interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_TXE   U32_C(0x08)

AS3911 end of transmission interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_WAM   U32_C(0x040000)

AS3911 wake-up due to amplitude interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_WCAP   U32_C(0x010000)

AS3911 wake-up due to capacitance measurement.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_WL   U32_C(0x40)

AS3911 FIFO water level inerrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_WPH   U32_C(0x020000)

AS3911 wake-up due to phase interrupt.

#define AS3911_IRQ_MASK_WT   U32_C(0x080000)

AS3911 wake-up interrupt.

Function Documentation

s8 as3911ClearInterrupts ( u32  mask)
Parameters:
[in]maskThe interrupts to clear.
Returns:
ERR_IO: Error during communication.
ERR_NONE: No error, the given interrupts are cleard.
s8 as3911DisableInterrupts ( u32  mask)
Parameters:
[in]maskThe interrupts to enable.
Returns:
ERR_IO: Error during communication.
ERR_NONE: No error, the given interrupts are disabled.
s8 as3911EnableInterrupts ( u32  mask)
Parameters:
[in]maskThe interrupts to enable.
Returns:
ERR_IO: Error during communication.
ERR_NONE: No error, the given interrupts are enabled.
s8 as3911GetInterrupts ( u32  mask,
u32 *  irqs 
)
Parameters:
[in]maskThe interrupts which status has to be checked.
[out]irqsSet to the interrupts which are currently pending.
Note:
A pending interrupt that is not selected for readout by mask will not be reported.
All reported interrupts are automatically cleared.
Returns:
ERR_NONE: No error, interrupt status read out successful.
s8 as3911WaitForInterruptTimed ( u32  mask,
u16  timeout,
u32 *  irqs 
)
Parameters:
[in]maskThe interrupts to wait for.
[in]timeout
  • timeout > 0: Wait operation timeout (milliseconds).
  • timeout == 0: No timeout, the function call blocks until one of the interrupts defined by mask occur.
[out]irqsSet to the interrupt(s) wich occured.
Note:
Any interrupt that occurs which is not selected by mask will not cause the wait operation to terminate and will also not be reported in irqs after the function call returns.
All reported interrupts are automatically cleared.
Returns:
ERR_NONE: No error, one of the defined interrupts occured or the timeout expired.
